First of all, thanks for providing a good platform to keep all games purchased stored at one central application. CS:Go has been a game I've been playing for many years. Even though I rarely get a high score I wouldn't go as far as saying it's a bad game because it takes skills, training and a strategic mind to accomplish anything above the average. Customization is also at a high level even though the handling of settings available could be more visible else than hiding them in a online manual and to private tweak sites. Since I do like marketing I know it's a fairly good choice because it keeps a vivid fan and enthusiasts along even though not being the most userfriendly. Gameplay is easy to understand - easy to learn and the graphics have been improved since the early years. I have met many of my current IRL friends through CounterStrike and been a part of the community around since the release of CS1.3 bought on a CD along with a magazine and even before the Steam platform was released. It seems that the devs keep coming with new updates, error fixes, skins, collectables and events at a good speed to keep it running (they haven't lost interest).
All in all a competitive environment but also very easy to find friendly people enjoying some fun together in the game.
